title: Into the Wind: Terry Fox [SDTV]

In 1980, Terry Fox continued his fight against bone cancer with the pursuit of a singular, motivating vision: to run across Canada. Three years after having his right leg amputated six inches above the knee after being diagnosed with osteosarcoma, Fox set out to cover more than a marathonÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s distance each day until he reached the shores of Victoria, British Columbia. Anonymous at the start of his journey, Fox steadily captured the heart of a nation with his Marathon of Hope. However the 21-year old BC native's goal was not fame, but to spread awareness and raise funds for cancer research. After 143 days and two-thirds of the way across Canada, with the eyes of a country watching, FoxÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s journey came to an abrupt end when newly discovered tumors took over his body. Two-time NBA MVP, proud Canadian, and first-time filmmaker Steve Nash will share FoxÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s incredible story of perseverance and hope.
